text: Orthologs of <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein are found in various species , including human , mouse and rat .

Motif prediction programming , using COILS [ 11 ] and MotifScan [ 12 ] , suggests that <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contains a coiled-coil ( CC ) domain , a ubiquitin-like ( UBL ) domain , and a zinc-finger Ran - binding protein 2 ( ZFRBP ) domain .

These functional motifs constitute similar domain profiles that are present in the <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein of all three origins ( Fig . 1A ) , suggesting that <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> exerts highly conserved functions across species .

Spontaneous mutations in the mouse <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene results in a complex inflammatory phenotype characterized by severe dermatitis ( Fig . 1B ) , systemic inflammation and an enlarged spleen ( Fig . 1C ) caused by extramedullary hematopoiesis [ 3 ] .

The endogenous expression of <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in BMDC was determined by quantitative real time-PCR ( qRT-PCR ) following culture in medium only or after stimulation with LPS .
<extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was present in BMDC generated from WT mice ( Fig . 1D ) and its level was modestly decreased by LPS stimulation .

text: There was a significant reduction of <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA ( 6-7-fold ) in BMDC generated from cpdm mice .

Transfection of Flag-tagged <extra_id_0> Sharpin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in fibroblasts ( NIH3T3 ) and macrophages ( RAW264.7 ) indicated cytoplasmic localization of the <extra_id_0> SHARPIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein ( Fig . 1E ) .
